excerpts: My friend had the Sinatra and seemed satisfied with it.
sinatra.author: Tif W.
sinatra.review:
Being a true yelp-believer, I researched and listed highly rated North Beach restaurants prior to walking the Barbary Coast Trail. We got as far as Coit Tower before the hunger pains hit, we were drunk, dehydrated  and tired. 901 Columbus Cafe happened to be the closest spot on the list. Yelp rarely disappoints.

They had a variety of vegetarian sandwiches and wraps. I got the DiMaggio, a vegan wrap with falafel, pickles, hot sauce, veggies and grilled to crunchy perfection. One bite into it and I was in food heaven. My friend had the Sinatra and seemed satisfied with it. 

Friendly service, great food and nice atmosphere. Too bad there isn't anything similar in Santa Clara.

excerpts: My wife had the Marlon Brando, it was so GOOD
, we can't remember what I had.
My sandwich was good also, but the Marlon Brando was just FANTASTIC!!
Oh yeah, $2 drafts, in SF, seriously!
marlon brando.author: Barry B.
marlon brando.review: Funky, eclectic place. Friendly service. My wife had the Marlon Brando, it was so GOOD, we can't remember what I had. My sandwich was good also, but the Marlon Brando was just FANTASTIC!! Oh yeah, $2 drafts, in SF, seriously!

excerpts: There's also some really good looking desserts like home-made tiramisu, various cheesecakes, biscotti, and other sweet treats!
Big, flat screen television showing sports and lots of board games to play with -- my boyfriend, Ian and I played a great game of Scrabble the last time we were here.
biscotti.author: Celeste M.
biscotti.review:
Best happy hour in San Francisco in my opinion.  $1.50 drafts... yes, only $1.50 for a pint of ice-cold beer!  Can you believe it... $1.50?!?!  Happy Hour is 5pm - 10pm, any day which means WEEKENDS, too!

It's not a bar, obviously, it's a cafe.  Actually, it's called 901 Columbus Caffe (two "ff"s), not to be confused with one of my favorite bars in North Beach, Columbus Cafe.  Food including soup, salad, and sandwiches; and drinks like caffeinated drinks and $1.50 draft beers!  There's also some really good looking desserts like home-made tiramisu, various cheesecakes, biscotti, and other sweet treats!  Big, flat screen television showing sports and lots of board games to play with -- my boyfriend, Ian and I played a great game of Scrabble the last time we were here.  It was so much fun.  

Great casual atmosphere, lots of people on their laptops taking advantage of the free wi-fi.  Outside seating also available during those hot San Francisco nights -- great for people watching (tourist and locals walking by or on the cable car, and looking at the Bikram students keepin' it hot doing yoga across the street).  

Will keep comin' back for more... more beer, off course.  Now for the catch... there's only 3 beers on-tap, only one the last time we were there, but it was still worth it because I cannot think of a better way to spend my $1.50 :-)!

excerpts: We had coffee, bagels and biscotti
and it was all delicious.
biscotti.author: A W.
biscotti.review:
We chose this cafe one afternoon because it was the midway point btwn our house and the hotel where our friends (country mice freed from their children for the day) were staying.
We had coffee, bagels and biscotti and it was all delicious.
I loved our Lodi bagel; feta cheese, tomatoes, basil and olive oil. Nummers!
I hope we have an excuse to come here again because their whole menu looked oh so good!

excerpts: I only had a fruit salad here, which was yummy...but the bagels looked good
and I'm definitely going back and going to see about parking my butt down with some wifi and Italian classic tracks in the background :o)
fruit salad.author: Diane S.
fruit salad.review:
Any place that makes me feel like I'm in my Italian family's living room at Christmas is AOK with me. What is WRONG with me?!!? How could I never have been here?! 

I was waiting to meet a bunch of friends here for breakfast and the best song came on "Eh Cumpari" - Julius Larosa - please download it and sing and laugh along if you are Italian! OMG- I called my dad immediately and said, Dad- what's that song you used to sing at Aunt Marty's?! Doot doot doot doot- ooh sah-o-phone...

Too funny.

I only had a fruit salad here, which was yummy...but the bagels looked good and I'm definitely going back and going to see about parking my butt down with some wifi and Italian classic tracks in the background :o)

excerpts: When I went, they had Big Daddy IPA (very good, super hoppy), Prohibition Ale (less hoppy but still robust amber ale), and a really great Belgian wit beer whose name I can't recall.
The guy in line ahead of me ordered a tea.
And it cost the same as my pint of delicious, local craft beer.
belgian.author: Alida R.
belgian.review:
I was staying at a nearby hotel on a recent visit to San Francisco.  I saw a sign hanging above this cafe near my hotel proclaiming "HAPPY HOUR 5 PM - CLOSE WEEKDAYS 2 PM - CLOSE WEEKENDS $2 BEERS."  I thought: "Surely it's a very small pour?  Surely it's crappy beer?  Or surely there is some other catch?  This is too good to be true!"

Ladies and gentlemen of Yelp, it's true!  They have three different Speakeasy beers on tap, all for $2 each!  You get full pours of them!  (A pint or a goblet, depending on the beer.)  When I went, they had Big Daddy IPA (very good, super hoppy), Prohibition Ale (less hoppy but still robust amber ale), and a really great Belgian wit beer whose name I can't recall.  The guy in line ahead of me ordered a tea.  And it cost the same as my pint of delicious, local craft beer.  How is this possible?

If I lived in San Francisco I would be here ALL the time.  Camp out with your laptop for the food/coffee/wi-fi during the day, then celebrate your day of hard work--or mourn your day of Facebooking/Yelping/reading the comments on news articles in spite of yourself--with $2 beers at night!

excerpts: I only intended to go in for a cup of coffee, but when I saw banana pecan belgian waffles on their menu, I knew I had to have it.
belgian.author: Stephanie H.
belgian.review:
On a lovely Monday morning off work, I decided to revisit my old stomping grounds in Northbeach. After a long walk up Columbus, I ended up at 901 for a cup of coffee, a good book and some free wi-fi.

Listening to Johnny Cash on their sound system, watching the cars drive down Lombard street and watching CNN on closed captioning was one of the best ways to start the morning. I only intended to go in for a cup of coffee, but when I saw banana pecan belgian waffles on their menu, I knew I had to have it.

The cappuccino was delicious and rich but didn't have the same beautiful artwork like the pictures. The waffle was the perfect texture--crisp on the outside and soft on the inside topped with banana slices and whipped cream. It was delicious and I was all too happy to spend a fantastic afternoon in a shop with reliable wi-fi and a great cup of coffee. I will be back.

excerpts: And don't forget the coffee with sugar free syrups - 901 has that covered as well.
sugar.author: Jason B.
sugar.review:
The recipe for a five star cafe:

- A delicious menu that can keep me all day. Start me off with a distinctive breakfast, follow that with a vast array of sandwiches and finish it off with an afternoon parfait snack. 901 Columbus delivered on each one - an excellent belgium waffle, a very satisfying turkey on ciabatta (bonus points for not charging to swap mayo for hummus) and a generously sized strawberry filled parfait. And don't forget the coffee with sugar free syrups - 901 has that covered as well.

- Free internet and plenty of outlets. Done and done at 901 Columbus. Too bad I was using it mainly for work.

- Friendly and attentive service. Loved how the guys working the counter let me open a tab. I was never rushed, totally could have been there open to close and no one would have cared.

Next time I might.

excerpts: I only intended to go in for a cup of coffee, but when I saw banana pecan belgian waffles on their menu, I knew I had to have it.

banana pecan.review:

The waffle was the perfect texture--crisp on the outside and soft on the inside topped with banana slices and whipped cream. It was delicious and I was all too happy to spend a fantastic afternoon in a shop with reliable wi-fi and a great cup of coffee. I will be back.

excerpts: Great waffles- banana pecan and strawberry chocolate chip were delicious!
Tasty smoothies and fruit juices.
I had something called Cubana or something; watermelon and lime juices fresh squeezed and blended- the perfect drink on a summer day
banana pecan.author: Jay B.
banana pecan.review: Love the neighborhoody vibe, the board games, the comfy couches. Great waffles- banana pecan and strawberry chocolate chip were delicious! Tasty smoothies and fruit juices. I had something called Cubana or something; watermelon and lime juices fresh squeezed and blended- the perfect drink on a summer day

excerpts: It's really hot in here (maybe because it was pretty warm outside), but the smoothie I had was good (strawberry banana).
Cheaper version of the Starbucks kind.
They also serve beer, which is cool.
A huge menu meets your eye on the wall behind the cashier, so it seems there's plenty of dining options to choose from.
If I'm ever back in the North Beach area, and needed a beverage, I'd definitely stop by again.
strawberry banana.author: Dan M.
strawberry banana.review: It's really hot in here (maybe because it was pretty warm outside), but the smoothie I had was good (strawberry banana). Cheaper version of the Starbucks kind. They also serve beer, which is cool. A huge menu meets your eye on the wall behind the cashier, so it seems there's plenty of dining options to choose from. If I'm ever back in the North Beach area, and needed a beverage, I'd definitely stop by again.

excerpts: Our family of four had a Strawberry Banana smoothie, Sinatra wraps, Turkey sandwich, and the salads that come as sides are delish.
All food was fresh.
strawberry banana.author: Andy P.
strawberry banana.review: Lots of healthy options. Cash only. They do have an ATM inside though. Our family of four had a Strawberry Banana smoothie, Sinatra wraps, Turkey sandwich, and the salads that come as sides are delish. All food was fresh.

excerpts: It's hard to describe how delicious my Babylonia Sandwich and Strawberry Banana Smoothie were at 901 Columbus.
I'll try, though.
(I'm plucky like that.)
They were SO delicious, I was humming to myself as I ate, and that's something I used to do as a kid, but only when I was really happy.
The Babylonia is avocado, cucumber, red onion, sprouts, hummus, lettuce, tomato, pickles and cheese, and I had mine on toasted wheat bread.
(Check out the photo, which makes me weep with nostalgia.)
The smoothie rocked 'til the break-a dawn.
Maybe I loved it so much because I'd just arrived in San Francisco, and was starving, and probably would've been ecstatic to munch on some Wheat Thins.
Still, I'd rate the meal highly under any circumstances.
strawberry banana.author: Robert M.
strawberry banana.review:
It's hard to describe how delicious my Babylonia Sandwich and Strawberry Banana Smoothie were at 901 Columbus. I'll try, though. (I'm plucky like that.) They were SO delicious, I was humming to myself as I ate, and that's something I used to do as a kid, but only when I was really happy. The Babylonia is avocado, cucumber, red onion, sprouts, hummus, lettuce, tomato, pickles and cheese, and I had mine on toasted wheat bread. (Check out the photo, which makes me weep with nostalgia.) The smoothie rocked 'til the break-a dawn.
 
Maybe I loved it so much because I'd just arrived in San Francisco, and was starving, and probably would've been ecstatic to munch on some Wheat Thins. Still, I'd rate the meal highly under any circumstances. Additional temptations on the menu included the Grilled Foccacia "Wise Guy" Sandwich (pesto, chicken, mozzarella, tomato and onion) and the Pastrami Melt.
 
Other plusses: friendly service, cozy seating, free WiFi, cute location (with an outdoor view of Lombard 's "crookedest street" in the distance), and what appeared to be a tiny lending library.

excerpts: I got the Maui Smoothie and a Hummus sandwich, both were exceptional.
maui.author: Michael N.
maui.review: Came here with my family after we concluded our walking tour of the famous Lombard Street. This place fulfilled all of our picky food desires! I got the Maui Smoothie and a Hummus sandwich, both were exceptional. San Francisco has some delicious eateries, and the 901 Columbus Cafe fits the bill. The service was impressively fast and we were all very happy.

excerpts: I ordered a Maui smoothie and it was delicious!
Also had an onion bagel, very burnt but still good!
I will definitely be back to try some thing else!
Awesome vibe & good customer service!
maui.author: Bailey C.
maui.review: I ordered a Maui smoothie and it was delicious! Also had an onion bagel, very burnt but still good! I will definitely be back to try some thing else! Awesome vibe & good customer service!

excerpts: Not only that, but the draft pale ale and house red wine is really really nice.
house red wine.author: turtle power e.
house red wine.review:
To the owner of this establishment,  I think you've accomplished cafe perfection! To start, everything one can consume here is perfect! I've tried just about everything. Let's see...there's the excellent espresso to compliment a delectable cookie or homemade tiramisu. There's the deliciously healthy wraps and sandwiches (Sinatra for veggie-lovers, or the WiseGuy for the carnivores). The salads are just as scrumptious, the soups are delicious. The waffles are heavenly (with bananas and pecans...or OR strawberries and nutella...oh dear).  

Then there are the beverage offerings! A perfect cafe must have excellent coffee and espresso which is exactly what you will find here. My first drink here was a zebra mocha which is a cafe favorite but lately, just having the solo espresso is satisfying as it is wonderfully rich and aromatic. Oh, and then, here's the best part...ahem... $2 drafts/$3 wines from 5pm?!? Seriously, you can't find a deal like that in any kind of cool neighborhood. Not only that, but the draft pale ale and house red wine is really really nice. 

The perfect cafe must also have the perfect ambience. This spot is cozy, comfortable, and unpretentious with nice music and lighting and even outdoor seating if that's your thing.  To complete the package, there's free wifi, computers and a printer if you don't have your own, an array of books and board games, and ultra-friendly staff to serve you. You can even zone out and watch the tube. And if you don't want to do any of that, the location is great for people-watching. Grab a seat outside and watch tourists, locals, and cable cars pass you by.
I've been to plenty of cafes in my time and this has remained my favorite the last couple years. In fact, I think I will head there now...all this time reviewing has got me craving an espresso. 

Here's to 5-star cafe perfection! Cheers!

excerpts: I go to Columbus and order myself a croissant sandwich and an ice cold chai latte.
Who am I kidding, I go here on my lazy mornings because I dread doing dishes from making breakfast because when I make breakfast, I go hard.
When I first had their chai latte, I was immediately impressed.
I had it in house and it was beautifully frothy, creamy, and super decadent for chai.
chai latte.author: Connie M.
chai latte.review:
Columbus Cafe is probably a tourist trap but `at least they deliver excellent breakfast sandwiches. When I like to indulge on my cheat days (Just kidding, everyday is a cheat day for me because breakfast is my favorite meal of the day) I go to Columbus and order myself a croissant sandwich and an ice cold chai latte. Who am I kidding, I go here on my lazy mornings because I dread doing dishes from making breakfast because when I make breakfast, I go hard. I should open up a brunch spot for aggressive brunchers cause I make a mean breakfast!

When I first had their chai latte, I was immediately impressed. I had it in house and it was beautifully frothy, creamy, and super decadent for chai. They probably used whole milk the first time which it probably why I was so enamored. 

The second time I ordered chai to go and literally the barrista poured milk into a cup and then some pre-made shelf stable chai mix that you can get from the grocery store. Charging patrons $4 for this seems excessive in my opinion because it's little to zero effort or artistry.

Freaking Lombard and it's tourist prices!

excerpts: They have an amazing B.L.T.M. and chai latte.
I've never had a bad experience here.
The staff is great, the service is fast, and they always play the local sports games.
I will continue to come here for as long as I'm in the city.
I would highly recommend the 901 to anyone in this area.
chai latte.author: Brittany B.
chai latte.review: I've lived in the neighborhood for 11 years. The 901 was always been one of my favorite spots. They have an amazing B.L.T.M. and chai latte. I've never had a bad experience here. The staff is great, the service is fast, and they always play the local sports games. I will continue to come here for as long as I'm in the city. I would highly recommend the 901 to anyone in this area.

excerpts: The menu looked tasty at first but my iced chai latte was sickly sweet and
chai latte.author: Kelli C.
chai latte.review:
Solid 3 stars. 

Cozy little cafe in a great spot, good atmosphere. Unpretentious. The menu looked tasty at first but my iced chai latte was sickly sweet and I'm pretty sure they made a mistake on my Corleone panini (it's supposed to come with pesto, but it had a marinara sauce on it instead?). It was edible but I probably wouldn't come back for it. Altogether a 4 for atmosphere and 2 for food, so a solid 3.

excerpts: I asked for a spiced chai tea and the barista gave me a chai latte with whole milk.
When I told him I ordered the plain chai tea, he argued with me.
He wouldn't give me my money back or provide me a different type of tea to replace the terrible latte.
He also refused to give me a side of eggs, which admittedly wasn't on the menu but many dishes have eggs.
The employees offered service grudgingly and refused to answer questions about the menu.
chai latte.author: Rachel B.
chai latte.review: The barista is RUDE! I asked for a spiced chai tea and the barista gave me a chai latte with whole milk. When I told him I ordered the plain chai tea, he argued with me. He wouldn't give me my money back or provide me a different type of tea to replace the terrible latte. He also refused to give me a side of eggs, which admittedly wasn't on the menu but many dishes have eggs. The employees offered service grudgingly and refused to answer questions about the menu.

excerpts: I had the chai latte and a bagel sandwich with egg, turkey and cheese.
Really light and simple.
chai latte.author: Johnny W.
chai latte.review: A little coffee shop at the bottom of the hill of Lombard street.  I had the chai latte and a bagel sandwich with egg, turkey and cheese.  Really light and simple.

excerpts: I asked for a spiced chai tea and the barista gave me a chai latte with whole milk.
When I told him I ordered the plain chai tea, he argued with me.

excerpts: I also had minestrone soup, which tasted fine, and italian soda.
Unfortunately the selection of syrup flavors for the soda is a bit small, but that just pushed me to be more adventurous and try something outside my usual strawberry-kiwi order.
Service is great; the waiter keeps an ironic playfulness about himself.
He was also more than happy to give my partner tips on how to drink her italian soda, as it was her first time.
The TV was playing The Never-Ending Story with captions.
italian soda.author: Tim M.
italian soda.review: 901 Columbus serves a variety of panini on foccacia bread and each one is spicy... exactly the way I like it.  I also had minestrone soup, which tasted fine, and italian soda.  Unfortunately the selection of syrup flavors for the soda is a bit small, but that just pushed me to be more adventurous and try something outside my usual strawberry-kiwi order.  Service is great; the waiter keeps an ironic playfulness about himself.  He was also more than happy to give my partner tips on how to drink her italian soda, as it was her first time.  The TV was playing The Never-Ending Story with captions.

iced chai.author: Kelli C.
iced chai.review:
Solid 3 stars. 

Cozy little cafe in a great spot, good atmosphere. Unpretentious. The menu looked tasty at first but my iced chai latte was sickly sweet and I'm pretty sure they made a mistake on my Corleone panini (it's supposed to come with pesto, but it had a marinara sauce on it instead?). It was edible but I probably wouldn't come back for it. Altogether a 4 for atmosphere and 2 for food, so a solid 3.

excerpts: The Iced Chai is delicious, I have to give them that.
iced chai.author: Emmanuella Z.
iced chai.review:
The cashier guy who works here is R-U-D-E! 

I haven't received crappy customer service like this in a while. I stopped by here with a few of my friends for lunch. Columbus Cafe only accepts cash. As we were reading the menu, thinking about the prices, because once again, It is JUST CASH, the guy is staring at us like we need to hurry up. Me and my friends frantically ordered some salads. 

We were in a rush to get back to our classes, and we kindly asked the cashier if he could be a little fast with our food because of this. He was rude and did not seem like he cared. Our food finally came. The salads were large in size, and nothing special. The Iced Chai is delicious, I have to give them that. 

Overpriced, and touristy. Probably won't come here again.

excerpts: Good atmosphere, reliable wifi, and an iced chai tea latte that tastes like apple butter (which I'm told is an Amish -- not California -- thing).
iced chai.author: Adam D.
iced chai.review: Surprisingly good. I wanted to go to a coffee shop and get some work done before heading to Trader Joe's, and this was nearby. Good atmosphere, reliable wifi, and an iced chai tea latte that tastes like apple butter (which I'm told is an Amish -- not California -- thing).

excerpts: I was wandering north through San Francisco on foot for a long time -- I finally stumbled into 901 Columbus Caffe when I heard Belle & Sebastian playing and went for an iced chai.
A great place to spend an afternoon with a laptop, chatting with friends, etc.
And I had a delicious onion bagel with cream cheese, tomato, and basil.
Mmmmmm...
iced chai.author: Moku D.
iced chai.review: I was wandering north through San Francisco on foot for a long time -- I finally stumbled into 901 Columbus Caffe when I heard Belle & Sebastian playing and went for an iced chai.  A great place to spend an afternoon with a laptop, chatting with friends, etc.  And I had a delicious onion bagel with cream cheese, tomato, and basil.  Mmmmmm...

excerpts:
Ordered the salmon bagel with cream cheese lemon and sprouts, Iced latte with hazelnut syrup and Iced tea.

Iced latte came WITHOUT the hazelnut syrup. 
Super bland coffee, didn't even taste the espresso.
iced latte.author: Annie C.
iced latte.review:
Terrible service. 

Ordered the salmon bagel with cream cheese lemon and sprouts, Iced latte with hazelnut syrup and Iced tea.

First of all, no sprouts. They were good enough to sub avocado at no charge.
Iced latte came WITHOUT the hazelnut syrup. Super bland coffee, didn't even taste the espresso.
Iced tea was good but again, very light.

Service was super rude. The bagel comes open faced and we asked them to slice it in half again (for easier eating). The guy gave us a rude look and said, it's open faced. Uhh...that still doesn't do it for me. Can I get a knife? Nope, he just walks away.

NEVER AGAIN!

excerpts: The smiling guy at the counter was eager to take our order so we hastily made our selection, a panini and an iced mocha and chose a table outside as it was way too hot and stuffy to sit inside.
The sandwich and coffee came quickly and were good, a nice addition to our afternoon.
Although there are so many other shops in the area, this one was reasonably priced, didn't require a long wait at the hostess table, and was quick.
I won't say it was the best sandwich I've ever had in SF, but it wasn't bad for the money.
Another time I'll have to try out their beer selection and maybe another panini.
Overall, nice place, nice people, fast service.
That's good in my book!
iced mocha.author: Emily S.
iced mocha.review: The hubby and I stopped in here after a long day of moving and apartment hunting. We were tired, hungry and in need of coffee. 901 Columbus Cafe was convenient and highly rated. The smiling guy at the counter was eager to take our order so we hastily made our selection, a panini and an iced mocha and chose a table outside as it was way too hot and stuffy to sit inside. The sandwich and coffee came quickly and were good, a nice addition to our afternoon. Although there are so many other shops in the area, this one was reasonably priced, didn't require a long wait at the hostess table, and was quick. I won't say it was the best sandwich I've ever had in SF, but it wasn't bad for the money. Another time I'll have to try out their beer selection and maybe another panini. Overall, nice place, nice people, fast service. That's good in my book!

excerpts: My friends and I walked in craving a warm cup of something to drink (we didn't want to go to Starbucks because we go there all the time and wanted to try a local spot) and were instantly set on ordering the Zebra Mocha because it is their house specialty.
Let me tell you - the Zebra Mocha was ON POINT.
I loved it.
I'll be sure to get it again whenever I'm in the area because it was perfect.
I ordered it with soy milk
zebra mocha.author: Vanessa M.
zebra mocha.review:
This place was cool! 

My friends and I walked in craving a warm cup of something to drink (we didn't want to go to Starbucks because we go there all the time and wanted to try a local spot) and were instantly set on ordering the Zebra Mocha because it is their house specialty.  And why not try their best/most popular drink since it was our first time here? 

Let me tell you - the Zebra Mocha was ON POINT. I loved it. I'll be sure to get it again whenever I'm in the area because it was perfect. I ordered it with soy milk and it was amazing. 

The place itself is pretty chill. There are tables all around and outlets so you can charge your phone or laptop. 

This place also has $2 beers! WHAT WHAT?! And I love beer. 

What more can I say? Even their menu looks good. 

Place is simple yet trendy and cool. I suggest everyone should visit this place and give it a shot whenever you're in the area. I love finding these gems in my city.  :)

excerpts: I had the zebra mocha and a panini and it ain't bad at all!
Coupled with the free wifi and cool neighborhood coffeeshop feel, it was a great escape from hustle and bustle
I'm used to in LA..
Street parking was plenty and, after the breakfast, we were all fueled up to just walk up the hill to our destination... too bad
I didn't have a chance to come back later in the day for their cheap beer and wine!
zebra mocha.author: Johnson K.
zebra mocha.review:
Stopped by San Francisco for a quick weekend trip and decided to go to a nice coffee shop for breakfast to take a friend over to the touristy Lombard Street.  What do I do?  Yelp it of course! Hahaha..  

I had the zebra mocha and a panini and it ain't bad at all!  Coupled with the free wifi and cool neighborhood coffeeshop feel, it was a great escape from hustle and bustle I'm used to in LA..  Street parking was plenty and, after the breakfast, we were all fueled up to just walk up the hill to our destination... too bad I didn't have a chance to come back later in the day for their cheap beer and wine!

excerpts: I ordered the "house special" the Zebra Mocha.
It was the worst coffee I've ever had.
The Monterrey bagel was horrible, the salmon wasn't fresh.
I would not return or recommend.
zebra mocha.author: rena s.
zebra mocha.review: Two people working the whole counter. Service was decent but slow. I ordered the "house special" the Zebra Mocha. It was the worst coffee I've ever had. The Monterrey bagel was horrible, the salmon wasn't fresh. I would not return or recommend.

excerpts: I dug the music; the scenery; the young lady behind the counter was very sweet for 9:00 a.m.; and my best friend said her zebra mocha was out of this world tasty.
zebra mocha.author: Cara S.
zebra mocha.review:
I stopped by this place on the morning of my wedding for a quick coffee. I dug the music; the scenery; the young lady behind the counter was very sweet for 9:00 a.m.; and my best friend said her zebra mocha was out of this world tasty. My coffee wasn't too shabby, either!

The Verdict: Had it been any other day, I totally would have hung out there. I would love to go back.

excerpts: The Zebra Mocha is heaven.
Love this place!
zebra mocha.author: Kim S.
zebra mocha.review: The Zebra Mocha is heaven.  Love this place!

excerpts: Their Zebra Mocha is yummy.
They have a big screen t.v.
if you'd rather watch t.v.
They offer real food if you crave non-pastries.
Service is fantastic (T and his team are major sweeties).
In fact, they took care of my one time complaint of insufficient caffeine high by customizing my coffee order for me.
zebra mocha.author: Caitlyn K.
zebra mocha.review: This is a great cafe so my only sour note is that it closes at 7 p.m.  What I like about this cafe is that there are a lot of plugs for laptop work.  They also have computers if you don't have your own.  They have an assortment of comfy seating (couch, love seat and stuffed bench) and traditional work seating (wooden tables and chairs).  Their Zebra Mocha is yummy.  They have a big screen t.v. if you'd rather watch t.v.  They offer real food if you crave non-pastries.  Service is fantastic (T and his team are major sweeties).  In fact, they took care of my one time complaint of insufficient caffeine high by customizing my coffee order for me.

excerpts: Great place, try the zebra mocha.
Free wifi is always nice plus outlets to charge up.
zebra mocha.author: stephen j.
zebra mocha.review: Great place, try the zebra mocha. Free wifi is always nice plus outlets to charge up.

excerpts: I'm a big fan of the salads, sandwiches, cookies (if they're fresh out of the oven which they often are), and the zebra mocha.
Days if I get out of work the $1.50 beers from 5-10 make any evening more bearable.
zebra mocha.author: Constance C.
zebra mocha.review: I work next door so I'm in here a lot. I'm a big fan of the salads, sandwiches, cookies (if they're fresh out of the oven which they often are), and the zebra mocha. Days if I get out of work the $1.50 beers from 5-10 make any evening more bearable.

excerpts: Order a cappuchino or a zebra mocha instead, which are both great.
zebra mocha.author: J S.
zebra mocha.review: Possibly the best atmosphere in North Beach, but with the worst coffee. They could serve instant coffee, though, and I would still come here every day. It feels like a living room, with a couch and a tv, and the staff here is awesome and sweet. Order a cappuchino or a zebra mocha instead, which are both great.
